meanings.definition: Steroid hormones that regulate glucose metabolism and suppress the immune system.
meanings.sent1: Glucocorticoids help control how the body uses sugar and fight off sickness.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes prescribe glucocorticoids to manage inflammation and allergies.
meanings.sent3: The immune system said, 'Oh no, here come those glucocorticoids again, trying to calm us down!'
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield of health, glucocorticoids act as the peacekeepers, calming the chaos within the body.
meanings.sent5: Imagine glucocorticoids as the traffic police of your body, directing the flow of energy and defense.

meanings.definition: Synthetic drugs that mimic the effects of natural glucocorticoids.
meanings.sent1: Athletes sometimes misuse glucocorticoids to enhance performance, which is not safe.
meanings.sent2: Pharmaceutical companies produce glucocorticoids to help patients with various conditions.
meanings.sent3: The fake glucocorticoids at the party were trying too hard to fit in with the real hormones.
meanings.sent4: In the world of medicine, synthetic glucocorticoids are like actors playing the role of the body's natural hormones.
meanings.sent5: The mimicry of glucocorticoids in synthetic drugs is like a copycat trying to imitate the original masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Hormones produced by the adrenal cortex.
meanings.sent1: Glucocorticoids from the adrenal cortex help the body respond to stress and maintain balance.
meanings.sent2: The adrenal cortex releases glucocorticoids in times of danger or excitement.
meanings.sent3: The adrenal cortex was proud of its glucocorticoids, always showing them off to other hormones.
meanings.sent4: Within the body's orchestra, glucocorticoids from the adrenal cortex play a crucial role like the lead violinist.
meanings.sent5: Picture the adrenal cortex as a factory producing essential glucocorticoids to keep the body functioning smoothly.
